2B1.1.title: Larceny, Embezzlement, and Other Forms of Theft; Offenses Involving Stolen

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the defendant convicted of an offense referenced to this guideline AND does that offense of conviction have a statutory maximum term of imprisonment of 20 years or more?

yesResult.description: Offense referenced to guideline with statutory maximum of 20+ years

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What was the loss amount?
What was the impact on victims?

options.label: 10+ victims, mass-marketing, or substantial financial hardship to 1+ victims

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve theft from the person of another?
Did the offense involve receiving stolen property by a person in the business of receiving and selling stolen property?
Did the offense involve theft of, damage to, destruction of, or trafficking in property from a national cemetery or veterans' memorial?
Was defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 1037 and did the offense involve obtaining electronic mail addresses through improper means?
Was defendant convicted of a federal health care offense involving a government health care program?
Did the offense involve conduct described in 18 U.S.C. § 670?

options.label: Yes, and defendant was employed by or agent of organization in supply chain

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve specified misrepresentations or violations?

yesEffect.description: Misrepresentation as charitable/educational/religious/political organization or government agency; misrepresentation in bankruptcy; violation of judicial/administrative order; or misrepresentation regarding financial assistance for higher education

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve relocation of fraudulent scheme, substantial part committed from outside U.S., or sophisticated means?

yesEffect.description: Relocation to evade law enforcement, substantial part from outside U.S., or sophisticated means

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve device-making equipment, authentication features, access devices, or means of identification?

yesEffect.description: Possession/use of device-making equipment or authentication features; production/trafficking of unauthorized/counterfeit access devices or authentication features; or unauthorized transfer/use of means of identification

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve conduct described in 18 U.S.C. § 1040?
Was defendant convicted under 42 U.S.C. § 408(a), § 1011(a), or § 1383a(a) with the statutory maximum of 10 years' imprisonment applicable?
Did the offense involve misappropriation of a trade secret with foreign involvement?

options.label: Trade secret transported/transmitted out of U.S.

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve an organized scheme to steal or receive stolen vehicles/parts or cargo shipment goods?
Did the offense involve conscious/reckless risk of death or serious bodily injury, or possession of a dangerous weapon?
What was the impact on financial institutions or large organizations?

options.label: Derived more than $1,000,000 gross receipts from financial institutions
Substantially jeopardized financial institution safety/soundness or endangered large organization solvency

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve intent to obtain personal information or unauthorized public dissemination of personal information?

yesEffect.description: 18 U.S.C. § 1030 with intent to obtain personal information, or unauthorized public dissemination of personal information

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What type of computer system was involved in the 18 U.S.C. § 1030 offense?

options.label: Critical infrastructure or government system for justice/defense/security
Caused substantial disruption of critical infrastructure

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve securities or commodities law violations by a professional in the field?

yesEffect.description: Securities law violation by officer/director of public company, registered broker/dealer, or investment adviser; or commodities law violation by officer/director of futures commission merchant/introducing broker, commodities trading advisor, or commodity pool operator

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What was the gain resulting from the offense?

options.label: More than $6,500
options.description: Increase by the number of levels from the table in §2B1.1 corresponding to the gain amount

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve an organized scheme to engage in insider trading?

yesEffect.description: If the offense level determined above is less than level 14, increase to level 14

2B1.5.title: Theft of, Damage to, or Destruction of, Cultural Heritage Resources or

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve arson, or property damage by the use of any explosive, explosive material, or destructive device?
Would applying §2K1.4 (Arson; Property Damage by Use of Explosives) result in a greater offense level than the level determined under this guideline?

yesResult.description: Cross reference to §2K1.4 for arson or explosive damage

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve theft of, damage to, or destruction of cultural heritage resources or paleontological resources, or unlawful sale, purchase, exchange, transportation, or receipt of such resources?

yesResult.description: Base offense level for cultural heritage or paleontological resource offenses

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What was the value of the cultural heritage resource or paleontological resource?

options.label: More than $2,500 but not more than $6,500
More than $6,500
options.description: Increase by the number of levels from the table in §2B1.1 corresponding to that amount

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the cultural heritage resource or paleontological resource from, or prior to the offense was on, in, or in the custody of a national park system, National Historic Landmark, national monument/memorial, national marine sanctuary, national cemetery/veterans' memorial, museum, or the World Heritage List?

Did the offense involve a cultural heritage resource constituting human remains, funerary object, cultural patrimony, sacred object, cultural property, designated archaeological/ethnological material, or pre-Columbian monumental/architectural sculpture or mural?
Was the offense committed for pecuniary gain or otherwise involved a commercial purpose?
Did the defendant engage in a pattern of misconduct involving cultural heritage resources or paleontological resources?
Was a dangerous weapon brandished or its use threatened?

2B2.1.title: Burglary of a Residence or a Structure Other than a Residence

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the structure that was burglarized a residence?

noResult.description: Burglary of a structure other than a residence

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve more than minimal planning?
What was the amount of loss?
Was a firearm, destructive device, or controlled substance taken, or was the taking of such item an object of the offense?

yesEffect.description: Firearm, destructive device, or controlled substance taken or targeted

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was a dangerous weapon (including a firearm) possessed?

2B3.2.title: Extortion by Force or Threat of Injury or Serious Damage

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve an express or implied threat of death, bodily injury, or kidnapping?

yesEffect.description: Express or implied threat of death, bodily injury, or kidnapping

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What was the greater of the amount demanded or the loss to the victim?

options.label: More than $20,000
options.description: Increase by corresponding levels from §2B3.1(b)(7) table

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What level of weapon involvement or threat preparation occurred?

options.label: Firearm used to convey specific threat or make physical contact
Preparation to carry out threat or demonstrated ability to carry out specified threats
options.description: Threat of death, serious bodily injury, kidnapping, product tampering, or damage to critical infrastructure/government computer systems

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What degree of bodily injury did any victim sustain?

options.label: Between bodily injury and serious bodily injury
Between serious bodily injury and permanent/life-threatening

specificOffenseCharacteristics.note: Cumulative adjustments from weapon use (b)(3) and bodily injury (b)(4) shall not exceed 11 levels

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was any person abducted or physically restrained?

options.label: Person abducted to facilitate offense or escape
Person's movement restricted through physical contact or confinement
options.description: Tied, bound, locked up, etc. to facilitate offense or escape

2B3.3.title: Blackmail and Similar Forms of Extortion

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does this case involve blackmail or similar forms of extortion as defined in §2B3.3?

yesResult.description: Blackmail and similar forms of extortion

noResult.description: This guideline does not apply - refer to appropriate guideline section

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What is the greater of the amount obtained or demanded?

options.label: More than $2,500 but not more than $6,500
More than $6,500
options.description: Increase by the number of levels from the table in §2B1.1 corresponding to that amount

2B4.1.title: Bribery in Procurement of Bank Loan and Other Commercial Bribery

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What was the greater of the value of the bribe or the improper benefit to be conferred?

options.label: More than $2,500 but not more than $6,500
More than $6,500
options.adjustment: use table in §2B1.1 corresponding to that amount

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant derive more than $1,000,000 in gross receipts from one or more financial institutions as a result of the offense?

yesEffect.description: If resulting level is less than 24, increase to level 24

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense substantially jeopardize the safety and soundness of a financial institution?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Apply only if greater than the adjustment from subsection (b)(2)(A)

yesEffect.description: If resulting level is less than 24, increase to level 24

2B5.3.title: Criminal Infringement of Copyright or Trademark

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What was the infringement amount?

options.label: More than $2,500 but not more than $6,500
More than $6,500
options.description: Increase by the number of levels from the table in §2B1.1 corresponding to that amount

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve the display, performance, publication, reproduction, or distribution of a work being prepared for commercial distribution?
Did the offense involve manufacturing, importing, or uploading infringing items, OR was defendant convicted under 17 U.S.C. §§ 1201 and 1204 for trafficking in circumvention devices?
Was the offense NOT committed for commercial advantage or private financial gain?
Did the offense involve a drug that uses a counterfeit mark on or in connection with the drug?
Did the offense involve conscious or reckless risk of death or serious bodily injury, OR possession of a dangerous weapon (including a firearm) in connection with the offense?

Did the offense involve a counterfeit military good or service whose use, malfunction, or failure is likely to cause disclosure of classified information, impairment of combat operations, or other significant harm to combat operations, Armed Forces members, or national security?

2B6.1.title: Altering or Removing Motor Vehicle Identification Numbers, or Trafficking in

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What was the retail value of the motor vehicles or parts?

options.label: More than $2,500 but not more than $6,500
More than $6,500
options.description: Increase by the number of levels from the table in §2B1.1 corresponding to that amount

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the defendant in the business of receiving and selling stolen property?

yesEffect.description: Defendant was in the business of receiving and selling stolen property

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve an organized scheme to steal vehicles or vehicle parts, or to receive stolen vehicles or vehicle parts?

yesEffect.description: Organized scheme to steal or receive stolen vehicles or vehicle parts
